decks.notes: The primary focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also utilizing direct burn spells like Lava Spike and Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent from the start and finish them off with efficient spells and combat damage. The mana base is optimized for consistent performance, allowing for both quick creature drops and spellcasting. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Skullcrack helps disrupt opponent's strategies and prevent life gain effects.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on maximizing damage output with odd-costed spells and creatures to take advantage of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion. By playing a mix of aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly. Blood Moon is included to disrupt opponent's mana bases, while cards like Solitude and Timeless Dragon provide versatility and resilience. The mana base is designed to support both the aggressive game plan and additional utility lands for added flexibility.

The deck focuses on cycling creatures and other cards to fill the graveyard quickly, with the aim of casting Living End to bring back all those creatures and overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes cards like Street Wraith and Curator of Mysteries to help dig for combo pieces, as well as disruption in the form of Grief and Subtlety. The key strategy is to cycle through the deck efficiently, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and then unleash a powerful Living End to win the game in one explosive turn.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly mill out the opponent's library using efficient mill cards like Archive Trap, Fractured Sanity, Ruin Crab, and Hedron Crab. Tasha's Hideous Laughter can also mill a large portion of the opponent's library if they have a lot of cards with the same name. The deck also includes disruption cards like Fatal Push, Drown in the Loch, and Surgical Extraction to delay the opponent's game plan. Overall, the goal is to control the game while steadily milling the opponent's library to win the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and various toolbox creatures to create infinite combos and generate value through sacrificing and manipulating creatures. The deck includes cards for tutoring creatures, sacrificing creatures for value, and generating tokens or +1/+1 counters to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes some graveyard recursion and protection elements to ensure consistency and resilience in executing its combos. The key strategy is to assemble the right combination of creatures and sacrifice outlets to generate a strong board presence and win the game through a well-timed combo or overwhelming aggression.

This deck utilizes a variety of creature toolbox options to assemble a combo win condition. By utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer, Stoneforge Mystic, and Chord of Calling, the deck can tutor for specific creatures needed for the combo. Cards like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Thassa's Oracle provide additional win conditions. Urza's Saga helps to find key artifacts like Shuko and Springheart Nantuko. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to respond.

This deck focuses on deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. Using cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, along with support from Eldrazi Temple and Cavern of Souls, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Additionally, cards like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Return help control the board while Devourer of Destiny and Sowing Mycospawn provide additional threats. Chalice of the Void helps disrupt the opponent's strategy, allowing the Eldrazi creatures to dominate the battlefield.

The deck focuses on efficiently cycling through cards with creatures like Curator of Mysteries and Shardless Agent, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Grief and Force of Negation. The goal is to manage the graveyard with cards like Architects of Will and Endurance, ultimately setting up for a powerful finish with Living End to board wipe and bring back strong creatures. The deck also incorporates cards like Subtlety and Waker of Waves for additional control and tempo advantages, creating a versatile strategy that can adapt to various matchups.

This deck focuses on using a variety of control spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also generating card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. It also utilizes powerful finishers like Murktide Regent and Flame of Anor to close out the game once the opponent has been sufficiently controlled. The deck aims to control the board and manipulate the game in its favor, while also maintaining enough threats to pressure the opponent and secure victory.

This combo deck focuses on cycling through your deck quickly while disrupting your opponent's game plan with cards like Grief and Force of Negation. The goal is to fill your graveyard with creatures and then cast Living End to bring them all back into play, overwhelming your opponent with a powerful board presence. Cards like Curator of Mysteries and Waker of Waves help you dig through your deck efficiently, while Subtlety provides additional disruption. With careful timing and planning, you can achieve victory by unleashing a massive wave of creatures onto the battlefield all at once.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive plays to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The deck includes cards that disrupt the opponent's strategy while putting pressure on them with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Orcish Bowmasters. With a mix of removal spells like Terminate and Fatal Push, as well as hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Grief, the deck aims to control the game early on and close out the match with powerful creatures and burn spells.

The deck focuses on assembling a strong aggro strategy using a mix of creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm opponents with a variety of threats. It includes powerful cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Solitude, as well as versatile creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Coiling Oracle. The deck also utilizes cards like Spyglass Siren and Kaldra Compleat to disrupt opponent's strategies and protect its own creatures. With a mix of removal, card advantage, and powerful creatures, the deck aims to establish board control and pressure opponents to quickly close out games.

The deck focuses on utilizing Hardened Scales to pump up +1/+1 counters on creatures and artifacts, creating a powerful aggro strategy. The deck includes synergistic cards like Arcbound Ravager, Walking Ballista, and Inkmoth Nexus to quickly overwhelm opponents. The goal is to build a board presence quickly and efficiently to deal damage to the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like The One Ring and Boseiju, Who Endures adds versatility and protection to the strategy, making it a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 gameplay.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to use the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring to provide extra mana and support for the aggressive creatures like Territorial Kavu, Nishoba Brawler, Scion of Draco, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer. The deck also includes powerful spells like Tribal Flames and Lightning Bolt to deal direct damage to the opponent's creatures or life total. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help to protect your creatures and maintain board control.

The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize, control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Pillage the Bog, and generate card advantage with cards like Relic of Progenitus. The deck also aims to ramp up its mana with Cabal Coffers and utilize powerful planeswalkers like Karn, the Great Creator. The companion, Jegantha, the Wellspring, provides additional mana fixing and can be a useful backup plan in case the game goes long. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent with its versatile control elements.
